description:
In 2023, Matt Poitras joined the Boston Bruins on a three-year contract after being drafted by the organization in the second round. At the age of 19, Poitras had immediate impact, earning his first point on an assist in his first-ever National Hockey League game. But his rookie season was cut short by shoulder surgery necessitated by an on-ice injury.

Now he’s back on
title: Bruins center Matt Poitras prefers to play left defense in NHL 25

description: Listen, I love the ROG Ally X, but its 1 TB of built-in storage barely puts a dent in my Steam Library. I know I could use a microSD card for some extra space, but the sub-optimal transfer speeds means downloading anything takes forever, and I don’t have that kind of time. Thankfully, there’s an solid 4 TB SSD on sale at Amazon for its lowest price ever. The 4TB model of the WD Blue SN5000 typically costs $299.99, but you can pick one up for just $199.99 for a limited time. The
title: This 4 TB SSD is matching its lowest price ever

description: Fans have wondered what HBO’s new Harry Potter TV show will be like since the moment it was announced in 2023: What would a long(er)-form retelling of the classic book series look like? Could the show get out from underneath the shadow of writer J.K. Rowling’s gender politics? Do we need to see Hogwarts again,
title: The Harry Potter TV series has found its Dumbledore

description:
The Sims 4 has been out for a decade, but those of us who played the earlier games in the franchise remember the iconic burglar. Part of the joy of The Sims games is having something randomly go wrong, all the way from a kitchen fire to a meteor crashing through your roof. One of these random hazards was the burglar, who is finally making their triumphant return to the series with today’s free update.

The Sims fans have been requesting the
title: The burglar returns to The Sims 4 after a decade of fan demand

description: I missed out on the original Yes, Your Grace when it launched in 2020, but I devoured it on my phone in a single evening. My only issue with the kingdom management title? There wasn’t enough of it. Thankfully, the launch of its sequel, Yes, Your Grace: Snowfall is right around the corner, and a free Steam Next Fest demo is now available, full of morally ambiguous decisions to weigh heavily on your soul.
title: Yes, Your Grace: Snowfall is going to put my conscience in mortal peril

description: More than two years ago, barely a month after Marvel Snap officially launched, data miners discovered something hidden in the competitive card game’s files. In addition to Marvel superheroes like Spider-Man, Iron Man, and Wolverine, the decidedly not-superpowered Uncle Ben was in Marvel Snap. Uncle Ben’s in-game function was — to Marvel Snap players, anyway — hilarious: “When this card is destroyed, add Sp
title: Marvel Snap’s long-awaited, darkly funny Uncle Ben card is finally here

description:
We’re roughly two months into 2025 now, and we’re already spoiled by the plethora of great new video games to choose from. Even still, there have been more than a few titles released late last year that slipped off our radar and nevertheless merit attention. TankHead, a roguelike vehicular combat adventure that stealth-dropped on Epic Games Store back in December, is one such game.

Created by Toronto-based indie studio Alpha Channel, TankHead centers around Whitaker, a digitized human consciousness housed within a

description:
Warner Bros. Games is making big cuts, closing three studios — Monolith Productions, Player First Games, and WB Games San Diego — and canceling its long-in-development Wonder Woman game, the publisher told employees on Tuesday. All projects from those studios have been canceled.

Monolith Productions developed Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor and its sequel
title: Warner Bros. closes Monolith Productions and MultiVersus studio, cancels Wonder Woman game

description:
Sorry, A Game About Digging A Hole, I’ve found a game that’s even weirder. It’s called Mashina. It’s also a game about digging, except you’re a little robot made out of trash, in a world also made out of trash, and it’s all kind of beautiful.

The first thing you may notice is how strange Mashina’s aesthetic is compared to … pretty much anything else on Steam. Everything is made out of real world objects, like wire
title: The most bizarre digging game on Steam is full of love and trash

description: The Steam Deck is almost perfect. Valve’s handheld has a beautiful screen, sturdy controls, and enough horsepower to run the majority of PC games. But since it’s a handheld, battery life is its achilles heel; If you like playing AAA games, a fully charged Steam Deck will barely last through a long lunch break — let alone a cross-country flight. Ugreen’s 20K mAh Nexode power bank is what you need, whether you have a Deck, or any other handheld. It has an impressive top charging speed of 130 W, and is $63.99 (20% off its retail
title: Every Steam Deck deserves a great charger, and this one’s 20% off

description: If there’s one thing that Hideo Kojima loves, it’s movies. The Death Stranding 2: On The Beach game designer and creator has never been shy about his passion for cinema, with his social media bio touting that “70% of my body is made of movies,” and regularly posting which of the latest releases he’s seen in theaters. title: Hideo Kojima was just as confused by Captain America as the rest of us

description:
Things have gotten pretty dire in the galaxy of Helldivers 2 right now, thanks to the events of recent Major Orders. The Meridia Singularity is now being directed towards Super Earth, and we don’t know how to stop it. Helldivers just went through several terrifying battles with new, mutated strains of Terminids, and to make matters worse, the Automatons are striking back on the northwestern front.

description: Framework, the company known for its laptops made with with modular componentry and hot-swappable ports (including a fully-featured modular gaming laptop), is getting into the desktop game. The Framework Desktop is Mini-ITX machine built in a 4.5 L case, aimed directly at the hearts of small-form-factor enthusiasts. Starting at $1,099, the Desktop features a AMD Ryzen AI Max chip that offers promising gaming perfo

description:
If you want a fused version of Kyurem, you’ll need to nab Volt Fusion Energy and Blaze Fusion Energy in Pokémon Go.

You can mainly grab this from doing raids against Black and White Kyurem, but Niantic has a few codes to net you free fusion energy to give you a bit of a boost ahead of the Go Tour: Unova event.

Below, we explain how to get Volt Fusion Energy and Blaze Fusion energy in Pokémon Go, and list the active codes for doing so.
title: How to get free Volt Fusion Energy and Blaze Fusion Energy with codes in Pokémon Go

description:
The Totem of Revelations is one of Avowed’s four god totems — collectibles that grant boons based on how many pieces you find. The Totem of Revelations is the god totem for the Shatterscarp region.

All seven fragments of the Totem of Revelations are hidden around Shatterscarp and its capital, Thirdborn. As soon as you find one piece of the totem (or purchase the “Fragments of the Eyes” key item from Cinzia at the Dead Swordfish in Thirdborn), you’ll receive a quest to find and complete the Eyes of the Obscured. The quest, however, is full of cryptic riddles.<
title: All Totem of Revelations piece locations in Avowed

description:
Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 and 4 is currently the worst-kept secret in video games at the moment. While the remakes haven’t been officially confirmed, a government entity beat Activision to the punch.

It was recently discovered that The Infocommunications Media Development Authority, which handles video game ratings in Singapore, includes a listing in its online database for Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 and 4. description: This post isn’t for you! It’s for me, because I’d love to add to my collection of official Zelda lore literature. The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia is currently on sale for $20, which is half off its regular price, and it’d look so good next to my Hyrule Historia. It’s simply a must-have book for Zelda fans who want to immerse themselves in the minutiae of Hyrule. description:
I was pretty sure I knew how Sakamoto Days would play out — trope as old as time, a retired hitman gets pulled back into the world of assassins and crime. I figured he’d be juggling his double life, hiding the more violent and dangerous aspects of his job from his sweet, unknowing wife. 

And for about four and a half episodes, it played exactly into my expectations. I was pleasantly entertained by the secret double-life hijinks, though not necessarily on the edge of my seat. But midway through
title: Sakamoto Days puts a refreshing twist on double-life hijinks

description: Making an efficient little machine out of nothing but cards is a great feeling. If you agree, then head over to Humble, where you can get a diverse collection of six deck builder games worth $149 for just $20 on Steam. Each game shares similar roguelike qualities, but with their own unique spin on the genre. description:
The Splitgate 2 alpha lets you play the next iteration of Halo with Portals for a brief period before its release later in 2025.

If you missed the first game, Splitgate really is as close to a multiplatform Halo as it gets, right down to the burst-fire “battle rifle” being a carbon copy of Master Chief’s signature weapon. title: What time does the Splitgate 2 alpha start, and how to access?

description: The Warhammer 40,000 setting is vast, and while most of Games Workshop’s attention is focused on the Imperium of Man and its vast armies of Imperial Guard and Space Marines, there are still tons of fascinating factions and alien societies to explore. title: A new Warhammer 40K book pits Farsight against the Tyranid menace

description:
Goichi “Suda51” Suda and Hidetaka “Swery65” Suehiro are two of the most idiosyncratic creators working in the games industry today, renowned for making cult classics like No More Heroes and Deadly Premonition. Hotel Barcelona sees the two teaming up for new game, and unsurprisingly, their sensibilities blend together to create something distinctly strange: a time-looping, side-scrolling roguelike about hunting serial killers in a supernatural hotel.

title: Swery65 and Suda51 are teaming up for a co-op, time-looping roguelike about serial killers

description:
Steam Next Fest — the triannual online event dedicated to spotlighting demos from new games — is back this month for another weeklong celebration of recent and upcoming titles. With only a week’s worth of time, there’s only so many hours one has to play through Next Fest’s best, let alone sift through everything else! The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (TMNT) event is skating into Black Ops 6 on Thursday, Feb. 27.

The TMNT event is coming with a ton of new rewards through its very own event pass. You can earn rewards like the new Skateboard melee weapon and D.13 Sector special weapon for free by earning experience or purchase the event pass to earn the ninja master, Splinter.

Here’s when the Black Ops 6 TMNT event starts in your time zone

After Charlie Cox’s Daredevil gets born again on Disney Plus, Jon Bernthal’s Punisher will be the next Netflix-era Marvel superhero to headline his own TV project, according to Entertainment Weekly.

description:
The latest episode of the Official Xbox Podcast came with some bad news for Fable fans: The reboot, first announced almost five years ago, has been pushed back to 2026.

Here’s what Craig Duncan, head of Xbox Game Studios, had to say about the delay — starting at 14:13 in the video above — while also sharing some new bits of pre-alpha footage with spokesperson Tina Amini:
title: Fable delayed to 2026, but at least Xbox is excited

description: Generative AI has been a controversial topic in gaming, prompting Steam in January 2024 to require developers to disclose use of the technology on their store pages. On Monday, Call of Duty news site CharlieIntel noticed that Activision had added such a disclaimer to the Call of Duty Steam page. The note simply reads: “Our team uses generative AI tools to help develop some in game assets.” It appears as though the disclaimer was added on Jan. 27 and simply escaped notice until recent reports.
title: Call of Duty updated with generative AI disclosure on Steam page

description: A lot of horror fans discover Stephen King on their own, pretty early in their lives, if only because it seems like he’s always in the news over one release, adaptation, event or another. Take the most recent batch of King-related screen projects, for instance. Oz Perkins’ goofy, gory short-story adaptation
title: Where to start reading Stephen King

description:
Konami is once again entrusting Bloober Team, the developer of 2024’s outstanding remake of Silent Hill 2, with its intellectual property for a new game. The publisher and developer announced a second collaboration on Tuesday, but did not disclose which game or IP Bloober Team would be developing.

“Our collaboration with Konami has been incredibly fruitful, and the success of Silent Hill 2 speaks for itself,” Bloober Team CEO Piotr Babieno said in a news release. “By sharing knowledge and experience, we have been ab
title: After Silent Hill 2 remake’s success, Konami and Bloober are teaming up again

description:
There are few series more consistent than the Like a Dragon (née Yakuza) franchise. You know each entry is going to greet you with positive vibes, unforgettable characters, bizarre side quests, and at least one minigame so good you would play it all on its own.

description: The War Within is a solid expansion so far, and Blizzard is preparing for the first major patch, which will take players to the trade capital of the goblins. The goblins have been part of Warcraft’s history since the real-time strategy games, but we haven’t always had the time to delve into their history or culture. title: The War Within’s first patch is a goblin paradise packed full of fun details

description:
Two Point Museum does not care whether I have to make dinner or not. Like so many other titles in the genre, this management sim churns forward, upward, and onward until the end of time — or until burglars start stealing money from your donation bin because you forgot to give the security guards a raise. Thieves are one of the game’s many natural challenges, along with museum exhibits becoming dusty, guests getting hungry, and trash accumulating on the floor.

title: The newest Two Point management sim is satisfying, monotonous, and punny
